name: Society_EXE
description:
Sandbox game where you're a hacker accessing the program that runs society. What if you made a few revisions? What's the worse that could happen. What kind of revisions do you want to make?  What will be the consequences?

The pillars of society await you, but only if you can nimbly jump from one to the other in order to gain access to each destination's password. Once you have a destination's password, remember it and use it to revise the programmed destinations at each location. There is a weird bug that it might not take a password the first try (it will say the password is invalid when it is correct), so try 2 or 3 times and it should take. The issue is that it doesn't always save the input the first time. Should be fixed in version 004.

You can jump (and double-jump!) on resources moving between pillars to help you get across, and if you fall you can "restart" or rather respawn (but sometimes over nothing so just keep respawning or Reload the level). 

Use WASD to move, SPACEBAR to jump, and Left-mouse click or Trackpad click to log into a location when you are standing on it. 

Use the ESC key to pause, restart/respawn, reload, and quit.

Lastly, and this is most important my Best Beloved, most pillars (not all) require a resource to exist. Once they run out of that resource they will eventually collapse. Don't forget that when you start muddling with things!
